The Node.js code snippet is using TypeScript with `tslib` to re-export modules from different files. It essentially exports all the exports from several modules so that they can be accessed from a single entry point. This is a common practice in creating Index files for libraries or services, allowing users to import from a single module instead of multiple individual files.

Here's a possible rewrite of the code:

```javascript
"use strict";

Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });

const tslib = require("tslib");

tslib.__exportStar(require("./SSOOIDCClient"), exports);
tslib.__exportStar(require("./SSOOIDC"), exports);
tslib.__exportStar(require("./commands/CreateTokenCommand"), exports);
tslib.__exportStar(require("./commands/RegisterClientCommand"), exports);
tslib.__exportStar(require("./commands/StartDeviceAuthorizationCommand"), exports);
tslib.__exportStar(require("./models/index"), exports);
```
